   He could not eat anything so he didn't take his insulin. He did not
   vomit or experience fevers/chills, nor any dysuria, new cough, or URI
   sxs. He did manage to go to his numerous medical appointments that day,
   when he was seen by PCP, [**Name10 (NameIs) 276**], and dentist.
   .
   Per wife, the dentist foud a large mouth abscess for which he was
   prescribed clindamycin 150mg qid x 7 days. Otherwise visits were
   without incident. Sugars have been running very erratically, with FSG
   on [**1-19**]- [**1-20**] ranging from 70's to 500+. Today, after returning from
   work, she found him slumped over at his computer and confused. Checked
   BS and was so high meter didn't read number. Called Dr. [**Last Name (STitle) 488**],
   rechecked BS, was still higher than readable, so called EMS. Was

   #) DKA - On presentation, AG 30, HCO3 9, glucose 769. DDx includes poor

   unclear whether this was acute precipitant of DKA or rather symptom.
   Appears that insulin regimen was very erratic, which is probably the
   precipitant.
   -- Continue insulin gtt@ 0.1units/kg, titrating for goal FS < 150.
   -- q1h FS.
   -- Aggressive IVF hydration with 1/2 NS @ 300cc/hr x 3L.
   -- once AG closes, will switch over to sQ insulin 1 hr prior to
   shutting off insulin gtt.
   -- if glucose <250 and still has AG, change to D5 1/2 NS.
   -- check lytes q4h.
   -- Aggressive lytes repletion, add KCL to IVF once K < 4.0.

   week for ? tooth abscess; however no abscess noted on exam, pt
   afebrile. Leukocytosis is also a classic feature of DKA so this is the
   most likely etiology.
   -- trend WBC count
   -- continue clindamycin 150mg qid as prescribed by dentistry
   -- Contact Dr. [**First Name4 (NamePattern1) 492**] [**Last Name (NamePattern1) 493**] in am at [**Telephone/Fax (1) 494**] to obtain further
   information in regards to possible tooth abscess.
   .
   #) ST depressions - In pt without known h/o CAD but with CAD equivalent
   in DM. Cardiac enzymes negative. Was most liekly a hypovolemic demand
   strain.
   -- Recheck EKG in am.
   -- Telemetry overnight.
   -- Cycle cardiac enzymes.
   .
   #) Hyponatremia - Psuedohyponatremia [**1-24**] elevated glucose.
   -- normalizing with glucose correction
   .
   #) Acute renal failure - In setting of DKA, intravascularly dry, BUN/Cr
   ratio > 20.
   -- Aggressive IVF hydration overnight as above, closely follow BUN/Cr.
   .
   #) Nausea/vomiting - Likely [**1-24**] DKA vs. viral gastroenteritis.
   -- Check LFTs, amylase (may be elevated simply due to DKA), lipase.
   -- Anti-emetics prn.
   .
   #) DM type 1
   -- DKA management as above
   -- lyrica for neuropathic pain
   -- [**Last Name (un) 276**] consult in am.
   .
   #) Foot ulcers/PVD - Followed by podiatry and [**Hospital **] clinic.
   -- call podiatry in AM for wound and dressing recs
   .
   #) HTN - Continue diovan, amlodipine, lisinopril.
   .
   #) Hypercholesterolemia - Continue statin.
   .
   #) Depression - Continue wellbutrin, effexor.
   .
   #) Smoking cessation - Possible that nausea and vomiting may be related
   to chantix; however, wife [**Name (NI) 495**] he has not been taking this med so
   this is less likely
   .
